intro: Indigofera cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical indigo, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and trifoliate leaves with small, rounded leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
